author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi <@&688090867927482525> , I just built geth from master and synced to Baikal and am using it as a local RPC node. 

I wanted to replace a txn where the maxFeePerGas is the same, but I multiplied the maxPriorityFeePerGas with 1000. The priority fee is still lower than the max fee per gas, and the network base fee is 7 wei. I get `replacement transaction underpriced`

author: jochembrouwer
content: I just replaced it by multiplying maxFeePerGas by 10

author: jochembrouwer
content: To me it seems that the miner only cares about the tip (and of course if the txn can still be included in the block, and what the tip would be in the current block)

author: jochembrouwer
content: Does geth have an internal limit on maxPriorityFeePerGas? I can foresee some problems here, we actually don't have something in the spec which limits the size of maxPriorityFeePerGas... I could foresee that clients cut off the max fee at other points..?

author: jochembrouwer
content: There is nothing in the spec which limits me to send a gigantic byte array of maxPriorityFeePerGas

author: jochembrouwer
content: It seems I cannot get a txn mined where maxPriorityFeePerGas is `Buffer.from(('ff').repeat(32), 'hex')` and maxFee is just some "normal" number

author: jochembrouwer
content: I just got a txn mined where maxPriorityFeePerGas + maxFeePerGas is exactly that buffer value

author: jochembrouwer
content: The Geth sealer node does not seem to participate in txpool, which is not nice since it always mines empty blocks, so it is harder to crank up basefee
